block.p: Jane Mason McManus and Steven Neil Klurfeld are to be married today at the Hammond Museum in North Salem, N.Y. Rabbi Roger Ross will perform a service incorporating Jewish and Christian traditions.

Ms. McManus, 29, will keep her name. She is a sports reporter at The Journal News in White Plains. She graduated from St. John's College in Annapolis, Md., and received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia University.
Jane Mason McManus and Steven Neil Klurfeld are to be married today at the Hammond Museum in North Salem, N.Y. Rabbi Roger Ross will perform a service incorporating Jewish and Christian traditions.

Ms. McManus, 29, will keep her name. She is a sports reporter at The Journal News in White Plains. She graduated from St. John's College in Annapolis, Md., and received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia University.

Her father, Edward McManus of Washington, is the chief conservator at the National Air and Space Museum of the Smithsonian Institution; he is also the president of the Washington Conservation Guild. Her mother, the late Jean Mason Miller, was a stockbroker in the Lincoln, Neb., office of PaineWebber. The bride is the stepdaughter of Karen Lyon.

Mr. Klurfeld, 35, teaches history and coaches tennis at Bronxville (N.Y.) High School. He graduated from the State University at Albany and received a master's degree in teaching social studies from New York University. He is a son of Shirley Klurfeld and Dr. Robert Klurfeld of Croton-on-Hudson, N.Y. His father, a retired podiatrist, practiced in the Bronx and Croton-on-Hudson. The bridegroom's mother, who is retired, taught the second grade at the Brookside School in Ossining, N.Y.
